item.title: Using blitzortung.org and lightningmaps.org to watch lightning roll in
item.description: A brief note on two pages I refer to during severe weather, like the storms that rolled through the area on Monday night and Tuesday early morning that led to tornado damage in Manchester on the morning of June 23, 2015. LightningMaps.org has a zoomable near real time map of lightning strikes. You can zoom and pan around looking at locations of lightning strikes, with a small (less than 10 seconds) delay.

item.title: 22-23 July 2014 Lightning storms over Lake Michigan
item.description:
This map from LightningMaps.ORG shows lightning over Lake Michigan and into Ottawa County, Michigan at about 11:15 p.m on 22 July 2014. Note the strong line of storms crossing the lake.
The corresponding power outage map is from Consumers Energy. Outage reporting generally lags behind realtime by 15-30 minutes, and of course not every lightning strike turns into a power problem (though sometimes it seems like it does). Ottawa County, Michigan radio feeds are available on Broadcastify.

item.title: Lightning map from StrikeStar
item.description: This lightning map for the continential US from StrikeStar is new to me for the season - you can really see storms move across the landscape if you only look for lightning bolts.
